title: Start
body:
This is a test!!!

The test continues!

And here is the last line.

title: Example_Encounter
body: No birds yet.

title: Example_SmallTalk
body: Example Dialog

title: Day_Chat_01
body:
Greg: The guide says this area has a nice range of species.

Greg: What bird are you're looking out for?

Greg: What about a Western Pipistrelle?

Judd: That's a bat.

Greg: Oh, right.

Judd: I just want some nice photos.

title: Day_Chat_02
body:
Greg: Oh look, a nest of baby birds!
Greg: I remember when my kids left the nest.
Greg: It feels empty, but I also have more time for hobbies.

Judd: I never had kids.
Judd: I wanted to, though.

Greg: Oh.

Judd: And baby birds are called chicks.

title: Day_Chat_03
body:
Greg: How long do you want to stay out here?

Greg: Before we take a break, not for the whole trip.

Judd: I dunno.

Greg: Five minutes? 
Greg: Five hours? 
Greg: Five days? 
Greg: Five years?

Judd: ...
Judd: If I were to guess, three more birds.

title: AW_Start
body:
An Acorn Woodpecker appeared! 

Look at that red cap!

title: Effect_Good
body: You did a thing and the bird is affected somehow!

title: Too_Agitated
body:
Your hands are too shakey to take a photo!

You need to relax!

title: Effect_Bad
body: Uh, ok, that bird is not looking happy.

title: AW_Battle_Exit
body:
Greg: Nice photo!

Judd: Did you know that Acron Woodpeckers like to hoard acorns?

Judd: They'll peck out lots of little holes in a tree, and then stash an acorn in each hole.

Judd: It's like swiss cheese, but with filled with acorns.

Greg: I guess sometimes the acorn... doesn't fall far from the tree!

Judd: Wow.

title: AW_AG_GREAT
body: The woodpecker is calmly adjusting its stash of nuts.

title: AW_AG_OK
body: The woodpecker is pecking out a hole in the tree.

title: AW_AG_BAD
body: The woodpecker is squawking and flying around.

title: Bird_Fled
body: They fley away. Drat!

title: Battle_Exit
body: Nice Picture!

title: AW_Approach
body: I'm hearing some loud squawks in this direction. Wonder what it is...

title: Bird_Found
body: Bird sighted!

title: BT_Start
body:
A flock of Bushtits appeared!

They're so fluffy!

title: BT_Approach
body: Sounds like there's a flock of songbirds in those bushes.

title: BT_Battle_Exit
body:
Greg: Nice photo!

Judd: Bushtits like to hang upside down sometimes when looking for food.

Judd: They're difficult to attract to feeders, because they only eat insects.

Greg: If there's 30 in a bush, how much would one in the hand be worth?

Judd: ...

title: BT_AG_GREAT
body: The bushtits are resting in some shrubs.

title: BT_AG_OK
body: The bushtits are singing and flying around.

title: BT_AG_BAD
body: The bushtits are swarming up, angrily squeaking!

title: AK_Start
body: It's an American Kestrel!

title: AK_Approach
body: Sounds like there's a kestrel-like bird nearby.

title: AK_Battle_Exit
body:
Nice photo!

Kestrels are North America's littlest falcon.

Of course, that doesn't stop snatching up all kinds of prey.

...

...

... yeah...

title: AK_AG_GREAT
body: The kestrel is resting on a fence post.

title: AK_AG_OK
body: The kestrel is flying around, looking for prey.

title: AK_AG_BAD
body: The kestrel is angrily diving at the ground!

title: Camera_NotEnoughShots
body: We should take a couple more shots to make sure we get a good one.

title: Run_Away_Option
body: Look for a different bird?

title: Run_Away
body: Yeah. Let's go look for other birds.

title: AG_OK
body: Your hands are getting a little jittery.

title: AG_BAD
body: Your poor breathing is spooking them!

title: AG_GREAT
body: You feel perfectly calm.

title: AG_LEAVE
body: The bird flew away! You spooked them too much!

title: Day_Chat_04
body:
Greg: These birds love to sing, don't they?
Greg: I wonder what they're singing about.

Judd: Mating.

Greg: Well, maybe there's other songs too.

Judd: No. It's only mating.
Judd: Mating and food.

title: Day_Chat_05
body:
Greg: I hope this last bird has a neat looking beak.
Greg: That's my favorite feature, the beak.

Judd: Yeah, maybe.
Judd: I perfer the plumage, though.

title: End_Of_Day
body:
Judd: Let's head back. I need a rest.

Judd: My hands are swelling too much.

Greg: Okay.

Judd: Knees are going too.

Greg: Okay.

Judd: Shoes don't fit like they used to.

Greg: ...

Judd: Used to be able to go out all day, not so much anymore.

title: Intermission_01
body:
Greg: Let's take a load off.

...

Greg: Hey, why'd you bring that bag of seed?

Judd: I wanted some photos of them eating.

Greg: We're not supposed to feed the animals here.

Greg: It's against the park rules!

...

Judd: Oh... this bag is mostly catfood.

Judd: Nevermind.

Judd: I don't even remember when I had my last cat.

TRANSITION TO NIGHT

4:00 AM

ALARM GOES OFF

Judd: Rise and shine.

Greg: Ugghhhhh

Greg: I'll never get used to this.

Judd: Yeah, well, we're up. Let's go snap some pictures while it's dark out.

Judd: And then we can get breakfast.

title: Too_Calm
body: You are already as calm as can be.

title: WS_Approach
body: Looks like there's something moving in the river.

title: WS_Start
body:
It's a Wilson's Snipe!

That beak is so long!

title: SJ_Start
body:
It's a Steller's Jay!

Wow! Such a bright color!

title: SJ_Approach
body: There's a hint of blue in the trees over there.

title: SJ_Battle_Exit
body: Nice photo!

title: WS_Battle_Exit
body: Nice photo!

title: Night_Chat_01
body: It is too early. Also something sad.

title: Night_Chat_02
body:
Greg: Where do you want to eat after this?

Greg: We could go to one of the restaurants in the park when they open...

Judd: They're probably too expensive.

Greg: Well, it's going to be a drive to go anyplace else.

Judd: Ok, fine. We can go to the restaurant in our lodge. They do breakfast at 7.

Greg: Sounds good. I'll need more coffee...

title: Night_Chat_03
body: Now it is night time 3.

title: Night_Chat_04
body: Now it is night time 4.

title: Night_Chat_05
body: Now it is night time 5.

body: It is raining

body: It is raining 2

body: It is raining 3

body: It is raining 4

body: This is the second intermission.

title: EG_Battle_Exit

title: Intermission_03
body:
Congrats for making it all the way to the end.

That is more effort than I expected.

TODO: have actual ending

title: Encounter_Tutorial
body:
Info: Hello, I am this computer game's developer with some helpful tips to get you through the game.
Info: Our goal here is to get a good photo of that bird over there.
Info: If you use your camera, you can snap some photos of it. I think we need ten photos before we get a good one.
Info: When you're ready to start, move your mouse cursor over the camera icon and perform a click.
Info: This computer game is operated only by moving the mouse and clicking, so don't worry about any other keyboard buttons.

title: Post_Camera_Tutorial
body:
Info: Taking photos can get stressful! If you get too stressed then you won't be able to operate the camera. 
Info: We may need to do some breathing exercises to calm down when that happens.
Info: Right now you're only a little stressed out, so you can take another set of pictures first, if you'd like

title: Camera_Tutorial
body:
Info: It is me, the game's developer again. Sorry to be back so soon!
Info: To snap a picture of a bird, hover your cursor over the bird and click the mouse button to snap a photo.
Info: Make sure the bird isn't touching the edges! We don't want them partially out of frame!

title: Breathing_Tutorial
body:
Info: Ready to chill out?
Info: Start by depressing the mouse button, and then release it when the blue meter near the green zone on the right.
Info: Then, depress the mouse button when it approaches the green zone on the left.
Info: You'll take 3 exhales and 3 inhales before being ranked.
Info: This first time though, take as many as you like! Once you take 3 ok full breaths you can move on.

title: Day_Chat_Intro
body:
Greg: Well, here we are. Yosemete park.

Greg: What a drive.

...

Greg: Is your camera ready?

Judd: Yeah.

Greg: Got your birding book?

Judd: Yeah.

Greg: Your best jacket?

Greg: Your lucky socks?

Greg: Your favorite teeth?

Judd: (Ugh)

Judd: Let's go snap some bird photos.

title: AW_Book
body:
Book: Acorn Woodpecker (Melanerpes formicivorus).
Book: Acorn Woodpeckers live in large groups and hoard acorns.
Book: They're pretty easy to find, and are tolerant of humans.
Book: They live in forests on slopes and mountains.
Book: They'll fly from tree to tree while you take pictures. Try predicting which tree they're flying to!

title: Node79
body: something about nesting being from garbage

title: BT_Book
body:
Book: American Bushtit (Psaltriparus minimus)
Book: Bushtits are tiny, kinglet-sized birds.
Book: They typically fly around bushes in large flocks, looking for insects to eat.
Book: Look around in bushes to get a picture. The Bushtit will fly away when you snap a picture, but there should be plenty more!
